_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The United Suppliers, Inc. - Orchard, NE operation is committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by continually improving both practices and measures to prevent the release of regulated substances.  In the event of a release, the Orchard facility is prepared to work with the Elkhorn County LEPC and/or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact to people and the environment.

The Orchard facility's primary covered process activity is the mixing of fertilizers.  These activities include storage and processing of anhydrous ammonia.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and processed into 10-34-0 non-hazardous liquid fertilizer.  Processing is periodic and usually occurs in the spring and fall.  Ammonia mixing with phosphoric acid occurs in a T-reactor.  The T-reactor is usually a contractor operation that is controlled by the contractor.  Water is used as both a reaction feed material and product stabilizer.  The Emergency Response Procedures for Orchard are coordinated with the Elkhorn County LEPC.

United Suppliers, Inc. - Orchard, NE has taken the necessary steps to comply with accidental release prevention requirements set forth in 40 CFR Part 68.  Orchard is also covered by OSHA's Process Safety Management standard.  The following briefly describes the prevention program elements in place at this stationary source:

Process Safety Information:  The unit maintains information describing the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with the covered process.

Process Hazard Analysis:  Studies are conducted to ensure the hazards associated with process operations are identified, understood and controlled.

Operating Procedures:  Written operating procedures are maintained for covered process operation.  These procedures address the following activities:  initial startup, normal, temporary, emergency shutdown, normal shutdown and startup following a turnaround.

Trainin

g:  A program is in place to ensure employee(s) are knowledgeable and trained in procedures associated with the covered processes.

Mechanical Integrity:  Covered process equipment is maintained consistent with generally accepted engineering practices.  Covered process equipment is routinely inspected and tested.  Maintenance activities are conducted by qualified personnel.  Deficiencies are corrected in a timely manner.

Management of Change:  Written procedures are in place to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and/or procedures.  Affected personnel are informed and trained to deal with authorized system changes.

Pre-Startup Review:  Technical and operational reviews will be conducted on new processes and/or modifications to existing covered processes.  Reviews confirm the construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable.  Reviews are completed prior to placing equipment in operation.

Compliance Audits:  Internal audits are conducted on a regular basis to determine the root cause of covered process incidents.  In addition to determination and correction, investigations are directed toward preventing reoccurrence.  Investigations become process safety information and are retained for five (5) years.

Incident Investigations:  Investigations will be conducted to determine the root cause of covered process incidents.  In addition to determination and correction, investigations are directed toward preventing reoccurrence.  Investigations become process safety information and are retained for five (5) years.

Employee Participation:  Orchard, NE unit employee(s) actively contribute in the following:  process hazard assessments, operating procedure development, maintenance procedure development, training development and implementation, pre-startup reviews, incident investigations, and compliance audits.  Additionally, employee(s) have access to all information pertaining to the facility's RMP.

Contractors:  Periodical

ly, Orchard may hire contractors to conduct specialized operation, maintenance and construction activities.  Prior to work, contractors are trained on the covered processes, relevant process safety information and emergency response actions.

Five (5) Year Accident History:  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five (5) years that have resulted in deaths, injuries or significant property damage.  Nor to our knowledge, has there been any releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage and/or environmental damage.

Emergency Action Plan:  United Suppliers, Inc. - Orchard, NE has a written emergency action plan.  This plan includes notification of the Elkhorn County LEPC to respond to a major release as United Suppliers, Inc. - Orchard, NE does not plan on responding to a major release.  Local authorities have been provided with emergency planning and community right-to-know information.

Planned changes to improve safety:  United Suppliers, Inc. - Orchard, NE views safety improvement as a continual process.  Periodic evaluations (both internal and external) are performed to assess the facility status.  At this time, and aside from sustaining maintenance activities, there are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding anhydrous ammonia.
